page.title: 06ROGGERHAM GATE INN
page.content:
THE PUBLIC HOUSE
{ROGGERHAM GATE INN.} Between Swinden Reservoir and Lee Green Reservoir, on the road between Nelson and Worsthorne, in the hamlet of Roggerham are six cottages and the Roggerham Gate Inn.
There has been an inn here for 150 years, originally in a nearby cottage where it was run by two brewers from Harle Syke, and since 1878 in the present building. The name Roggerham is derived from "Rogues of the Hamlet" who waylaid pack-horses on the way between Lancashire and Yorkshire.
Mr. David Johnson has owned the pub for tha last 19 years and is very happy here. He has a number of regular
